title: Watch this wild (and inspirational) video out of New Bedford following the blizzard
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: A New Bedford pickup truck driver drove through unplowed streets following a blizzard, impressing local residents.
Scott Vicente navigated difficult conditions to check on properties, advising locals to avoid unplowed side streets.
Many New Bedford residents, including Allie Crane, contributed to snow removal after streets remained snow-covered.

title: 5 best new restaurant openings and dining updates in Boston (Feb. 26, 2026)
author: Katelyn Umholtz
bullets: Chef Douglass Williams will open La Tavernetta in East Boston's former The Smoke Shop BBQ space, planned for spring 2026.
Salt & Straw ice cream is expanding to a second New England location in Seaport, set to open late 2026.
Sorella Cucina Toscana has opened in Burlington, offering Italian cuisine with dishes like lobster gnocchi and veal osso bucco.

title: Patriots still deciding what former defensive coordinator Terrell Williams’s role will be
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Terrell Williams will remain with the Patriots in a yet-to-be-defined high-ranking role under coach Mike Vrabel.
Williams missed part of last season due to prostate cancer, leading to Zak Kuhr taking over as interim defensive coordinator.
Kuhr has been named the permanent defensive coordinator after helping the Patriots win 14 of their last 16 games.

title: ‘Jeopardy!’ contestants struggled with a Boston category. Can you beat them?
author: Kevin Slane
bullets: 'Jeopardy!' contestants answered three out of five questions correctly in the 'Boston Space' category on February 23, 2026.
The $800 and $1000 clues about Faneuil Hall and Back Bay resulted in triple stumpers with no contestant answers.
One contestant mistakenly identified Boston Common as Harvard Yard for the $600 question about a 50-acre pentagon.

title: What we get wrong about sex, love, and monogamy
author: Meredith Goldstein
bullets: Kinsey Institute director Justin Garcia discusses intimacy, 'slow love,' and modern relationships on the Love Letters podcast.
Garcia's book, 'The Intimate Animal,' explores social and sexual monogamy as distinct mechanisms impacting relationships.
'Slow love' describes young people's cautious and prolonged approach to relationships, differing from previous generations.

title: Tom Brady calls FIFA president ‘man of the people’ ahead of 2026 World Cup
author: Hayden Bird
bullets: Tom Brady praises FIFA president Gianni Infantino as 'a man of the people' despite criticism from local fans and organizers.
Brady participated in the FIFA World Cup draw, expressing excitement for the increased inclusion with 48 participating countries.
Infantino's actions, including participation in controversial events, have raised questions about his alignment with common soccer fans.

title: ‘We just do it’: Massachusetts plow drivers recount 24-hour shift during blizzard
author: Annie Jonas
bullets: Massachusetts plow drivers worked 24-hour shifts following a Feb. 23 blizzard that dropped up to 3 feet of snow.
Supply shortages and equipment repairs complicated snow removal efforts across Southeast Massachusetts, with snow crews operating under challenging conditions.
Plow drivers emphasized community support and exhaustion, highlighting dedication to clear streets and provide access amid extreme weather.

title: 4 charged in alleged $7M pandemic relief fraud scheme
author: Samantha Genzer
bullets: Lorne Johnson, Sniders Jean-Jacques, Tanya Pierre, and Ashley Spike charged in $7 million PPP fraud scheme.
Defendants allegedly submitted false PPP applications, securing loans for unqualified borrowers and creating fake tax documents.
Jean-Jacques and Pierre face additional charges for a separate mortgage fraud scheme.

title: Orange Line to shut down between Back Bay and Forest Hills for 9 days
author: Samantha Genzer
bullets: The MBTA will suspend Orange Line service between Back Bay and Forest Hills from February 28 to March 8.
Free shuttle buses and fare-free commuter rail service will be available during the nine-day Orange Line shutdown.
The shutdown supports ongoing upgrades replacing the Orange Line's analog signal system with new digital infrastructure.

title: Missing Weymouth man found dead after blizzard
author: Samantha Genzer
bullets: Brendan L. Rogers, 45, was found dead in a wooded area near the Fore River after going missing during a blizzard.
Rogers was last seen on foot leaving his Weymouth home Monday morning with no foul play suspected in his death.
An extensive search involved multiple police units, with authorities expressing condolences to Rogers's family and friends.
